p: Based on our thematic analysis, the most common theme identified was opioid use, followed by heroin abuse. In Indiana, between 2005 and 2014, hospital admissions for heroin and prescription drug abuse increased 413% and 155% respectively, reflecting a growing problem of opioid-and heroin-related substance abuse behavior in the state [ 22]. In our dataset, we detected tweets self-reporting both heroin and opioid use, including examples of IDU and reports of overdose around Scott County. The demographic of IDU among people who inject drugs (PWIDs) and HIV in the USA has been primarily black, male, and urban, whereas the Indiana HIV outbreak demographic was among younger, white, and rural users [ 2]. This epidemiological profile is similar to current heroin users in the United States, potentially indicating that the demographic makeup of the state may have put users at higher risk for transition from opioid abuse to heroin injection drug use [ 2].
